ca.ualberta.cmput301f20t04.bookatmenow

Class DBHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cmput301f20t04.bookatmenow.DBHandler

  • public class DBHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Handler class Deals with all DB interaction Contains Transactions, Getters and Setters for DB data All Getters return listeners to allow for activity on result

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DBHandler()
      Basic handler to create a DB instance

    • Method Detail

      • addUser

        public void addUser(User userToAdd,
                    com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.lang.Boolean> successListener,
                    com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
        Adds a user to the database, expects user to not exist in DB, going forward with this will override ALL previous user data, use carefully DATA IS NOT MERGED
        Parameters:
        userToAdd - User object, can come in any flavour and will simply autofill data as null
        successListener - Listener for success, returns True bool
        failureListener - Listener for failure

      • removeUser

        public void removeUser(java.lang.String uuid,
                       com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.lang.Boolean> successListener,
                       com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
        Removes a given user
        Parameters:
        uuid - User's uuid, a string
        successListener - Listener that simply returns a True boolean when the task succeeds, a way for you to know when/if the task succeeded
        failureListener - Listener for when task fails

      • getUser

        public void getUser(java.lang.String uuid,
                    com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<User> successListener,
                    com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
        Getter for user data, returns user object minus password
        Parameters:
        uuid - User's uuid
        successListener - Listener to act on retrieved data
        failureListener - Listener to act when data not retrieved

      • updateUser

        public void updateUser(User userToAdd,
                       com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.lang.Boolean> successListener,
                       com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
        Updates the data of a given user When updating user data DO NOT CHANGE UUID If UUID is missing, method will end without making changes and log the error If method does not return True, it failed, terminate immediately
        Parameters:
        userToAdd - User object with all updated info
        successListener - Listener to act on successful update
        failureListener - Listener to act on failed update

      • usernameExists

        public void usernameExists(java.lang.String username,
                           com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.lang.String> onSuccessListener,
                           com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onFailureListener)
        Username checker method, checks if a given username exists in the DB; usernames ARE case sensitive, returns UUID or null
        Parameters:
        username - User's username, a string
        onSuccessListener - Listener for the query succeeding, returns a string
        onFailureListener - Listener for the query failing

      • emailExists

        public void emailExists(java.lang.String email,
                        com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.lang.String> onSuccessListener,
                        com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onFailureListener)
        Works identical to usernameExists, but checks for email; NOT case sensitive, returns UUID or Null
        Parameters:
        email - Email to check, a string
        onSuccessListener - Listener for success, returns string
        onFailureListener - Listener for failure

      • loginHandler

        public void loginHandler(java.lang.String user,
                         java.lang.String password,
                         com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> successListener,
                         com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
        Login handler, sends user data into app given login criteria is met
        Parameters:
        user - Username/email string
        password - Password string
        successListener - Listener for successful retrieval
        failureListener - Listener for failed retrieval

      • addBook

        public void addBook(Book bookToAdd,
                    com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.lang.Boolean> successListener,
                    com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Rudimentary add book handler, does not do any checks and fills fields as empty when no data provided.
        Parameters:
        bookToAdd - Book object containing complete or incomplete book data, handler will fill everything else with an empty string
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getBook

        public void getBook(java.lang.String isbn,
                    com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Book> successListener,
                    com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
        Get book handler, assumes book exists and tries to retrieve it
        Parameters:
        isbn - String with ISBN for desired book
        successListener - Listener to act on success
        failureListener - Listener to act on failure

      • getAllBooks

        public void getAllBooks(com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.util.List<Book>> successListener,
                        com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
        Gives the provided success listener an array list of book objects
        Parameters:
        successListener - Listener to act on the success of the query
        failureListener - Listener to act on the failure of a query

      • searchBooks

        public void searchBooks(java.util.List<java.lang.String> terms,
                        com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.util.List<Book>> successListener,
                        com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
        Searching method, returns an array of books based on an array of terms; searching code references the Description field on the database
        Parameters:
        terms - List containing words the user wants to search by
        successListener - Listener to handle successful retrieval
        failureListener - Listener to handle unsuccessful retrueval

      • userRequests

        public void userRequests(java.lang.String uuid,
                         com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.util.List<Book>> successListener,
                         com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
        Returns all books requested by specific UUID
        Parameters:
        uuid - User ID of the user to check for
        successListener - Listener to act when data is successfully retrieved
        failureListener - Listener to act if data retrieval fails

      • removeBook

        public void removeBook(java.lang.String isbn,
                       com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.lang.Boolean> successListener,
                       com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
        Basic book removal method.
        Parameters:
        isbn - ISBN of a book to remove, a string
        successListener - Listener returning true if book is successfuly removed
        failureListener - Listener to act on DB failure

      • bookRequests

        public void bookRequests(java.util.List<java.lang.String> uuids,
                         com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.util.List<User>> successListener,
                         com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
        Special retriever, returns a list of all the users requesting a specific book
        Parameters:
        uuids - List of UUIDs to be retrieved
        successListener - Success listener to act on retrieved list of user objects
        failureListener - Failure listener

      • addNotification

        public void addNotification(Notification notification,
                            com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.lang.String> successListener,
                            com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
        Stores an existing notification in the database; creates UUID for notification identification
        Parameters:
        notification - Notification object to store
        successListener - Listener for DB success
        failureListener - Listener for DB failure

      • getNotifications

        public void getNotifications(java.lang.String uuid,
                             com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.util.List<Notification>> successListener,
                             com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
        Getter to retrieve notifications from DB
        Parameters:
        uuid - UUID of the user meant to receive the notification
        successListener - Listener to handle success
        failureListener - Listener to handle failure

      • removeNotification

        public void removeNotification(java.lang.String uuid,
                               com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<java.lang.Boolean> successListener,
                               com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener failureListener)
        Notification removal method. Deletes a notification from the DB based on its UUID
        Parameters:
        uuid - UUID of notification
        successListener - Listener to handle success
        failureListener - Listener to handle failure
